bibl.title: The Liber Pontificalis and Red Sea Trade of the Early to Mid 4th Century AD.
Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010.

bibl.note: Contents, date and reliability. - Eastern commodities in the Liber Pontificalis. - Commodities. - Quantities and prices. - Places. - Properties and trade routes. Church involvement in the Red Sea trade? - The significance of the Liber Pontificalis for Red Sea trade of the early to mid 4th century.
bibl.seg: Eivind H. Seland, The Liber Pontificalis and Red Sea Trade of the Early to Mid 4th Century AD.

Dionisius A. Agius, John P. Cooper, Athena Trakadas & Chiara Zazzaro (edd.), Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010 = British Foundation for the Study of Arabia Monographs. 12 = BAR International Series. 2346 (Oxford, 2012) pp. 117-126, 5 tabl., 1 carte.

Contents, date and reliability. - Eastern commodities in the Liber Pontificalis. - Commodities. - Quantities and prices. - Places. - Properties and trade routes. Church involvement in the Red Sea trade? - The significance of the Liber Pontificalis for Red Sea trade of the early to mid 4th century.
